intro: Roulinia mannii, commonly known as the African starleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along stream banks. The plant is also noted for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
